children.text: There is a visible hole or leak point in the balcony waterproofing system, where water may be able to leak through and damage the building elements.
Part 3.8.1.3 - External above ground membranes of the NCC’s Building Code of Australia requires that
‘Waterproofing membranes for external above ground use must comply with AS 4654.1 and AS 4654.2’
, and the relevant Australian Standard AS 4654.2 Waterproofing membranes for external above-ground use requires that the balcony be fully waterproofed.
Additionally, the builder warrants that the work will be carried out in
, which is not the case in this area.
These areas must be rectified to be fully waterproofed to protect the building elements from damage in accordance with the BCA, Australian Standards and manufacturer’s requirements.
